mixed-citation.article-title: Taxonomy of Micronectidae (Heteroptera: Nepomorpha) from Vietnam, with descriptions of 11 new species

tp:treatment-sec.p: Micronecta guttatostriata Lundblad, 1933b: 101–102 , pl. I ( type locality: Java , Indonesia ).

Micronecta guttatostriata – Wróblewski 1967: 240 , 242–243, figs 11–16 (redescription, assigned to subgenus Lundbladella ); 1968: 775 (checklist). — Nieser 2000: 287 , fig. 39 (key); 2002b: 266, fig. 7 (notes, key). — Polhemus 2017: 127 (record Cambodia ).

Body length 2.0–2.4. Dorsum generally dark brown. Pronotum slightly longer than median head length, with two transverse yellow stripes on anterior part. Hemelytron ( Fig. 5B ) with yellowish brown background and longitudinal yellowish stripes usually fragmented into small dots; embolium with three translucent patches.

Males: fore femur with a pair of spines on proximal third ventrally; fore tibia without spine ( Fig. 6E ); palar claw, median lobe of sternite VII and free lobe ( Fig. 6F ) as in diagnosis for subgenus. Left paramere: shaft slender, basally straight and curved at distal fourth; basal lobe broad, trapezoid ( Fig. 6H ). Right paramere: shaft broadly curved, distal half strongly broadened ( Fig. 6G ).

Vietnam : Ninh Binh (Cuc Phuong) ( Wróblewski 1967 ); first records for Cao Bang , Phu Tho , Hanoi , Thanh Hoa , Nghe An , Dong Nai . Other countries: southwestern China , Thailand , Indonesia , Peninsular Malaysia , Cambodia ( Lundblad 1933b ; Nieser 2000 , 2002b ; Nieser et al. 2005 ; Polhemus 2017 ).

In Vietnam , M. guttatostriata is one of two species without a strigil; the other one is M. grisea . Micronecta guttatostriata can be separated from the latter by its distinctly smaller size, with body length of around 2.0– 2.4 mm , and the unique colour pattern of the pronotum. In addition, the shape of the free lobe and the parameres are reliable characteristics for identifying this species.
